algorithms.name: AES
algorithms.description: Advanced Encryption Standard - A widely used symmetric encryption algorithm.
algorithms.principle: AES operates on 128-bit blocks of data and uses a key that can be 128, 192, or 256 bits. It's an iterative cipher, meaning it applies the same set of transformations, called 'rounds', to the data block. The number of rounds depends on the key length (10, 12, or 14 rounds).

visualizationSteps.title: 1. State Array Preparation
visualizationSteps.explanation: The input text is converted into a 4x4 matrix of bytes, known as the 'state array'. This is the primary data structure that AES manipulates.

visualizationSteps.title: 2. Key Expansion
visualizationSteps.explanation: The secret key is expanded into a set of 'round keys'. A different round key is used for each round of encryption to ensure security.

visualizationSteps.title: 3. Initial Round - AddRoundKey
visualizationSteps.explanation: The initial state array is combined with the first round key using a bitwise XOR operation. This is the first step of scrambling the data.

visualizationSteps.title: 4. Main Rounds (9 for 128-bit keys)
visualizationSteps.explanation: The core of AES. This step is repeated multiple times. Each round consists of four transformations: SubBytes, ShiftRows, MixColumns, and AddRoundKey.

visualizationSteps.title: 4a. SubBytes Transformation
visualizationSteps.explanation: Each byte in the state array is substituted with another byte from a lookup table called the 'S-box'. This provides non-linearity to the encryption.

visualizationSteps.title: 4b. ShiftRows Transformation
visualizationSteps.explanation: The bytes in each row of the state array are cyclically shifted. This permutation step helps diffuse the data across the block.

visualizationSteps.title: 4c. MixColumns Transformation
visualizationSteps.explanation: Each column of the state array is transformed using a mathematical operation over a finite field. This provides further diffusion.

visualizationSteps.title: 4d. AddRoundKey Transformation
visualizationSteps.explanation: The state is XORed with the corresponding round key for the current round.

visualizationSteps.title: 5. Final Round
visualizationSteps.explanation: The final round is similar to a main round, but it omits the 'MixColumns' step.

visualizationSteps.title: 6. Final Ciphertext
visualizationSteps.explanation: After the final round, the state array holds the encrypted data, which is then presented as the final ciphertext.

algorithms.name: DES
algorithms.description: Data Encryption Standard - An older symmetric-key algorithm.

algorithms.name: TripleDES
algorithms.description: Triple Data Encryption Algorithm - Applies DES three times.

algorithms.name: RC4
algorithms.description: Rivest Cipher 4 - A widely used stream cipher.

algorithms.name: RC4Drop
algorithms.description: RC4 with a modified key-scheduling algorithm, dropping initial output.

imageAlgorithms.name: Pixel Scramble
imageAlgorithms.description: Shuffles the positions of pixels in the image based on the key. Creates a mosaic effect.

imageAlgorithms.name: Color Scramble
imageAlgorithms.description: Swaps the Red, Green, and Blue channels of each pixel based on the key. Distorts colors.

imageAlgorithms.name: XOR Cipher
imageAlgorithms.description: Applies a bitwise XOR operation to each pixel's color values. Creates a noisy, static-like image.
